conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the normal force F_N between the latch D and the lock groove E when the lock is in a self-locking state, we need to analyze the forces acting on the latch and the conditions for self-locking.
Spring Force (F_s): The spring is compressed by a distance x, so the spring force is F_s = kx, acting horizontally to the left.
Normal Force (F_N): Acts perpendicular to the surface of the latch D in contact with the lock groove E.
Frictional Force (F_f): Acts opposite to the potential motion, parallel to the surface of contact. The maximum static friction force is F_{fm} = μF_N.

premise: The normal force F_N can be resolved into horizontal and vertical components due to the inclination angle θ = 30°.
conclusion: Horizontal component: F_{N_x} = F_N cos θ

premise: The normal force F_N can be resolved into horizontal and vertical components due to the inclination angle θ = 30°.
conclusion: Vertical component: F_{N_y} = F_N sin θ

premise: The frictional force F_f also has components.
conclusion: Horizontal component: F_{f_x} = F_f cos θ

premise: The frictional force F_f also has components.
conclusion: Vertical component: F_{f_y} = F_f sin θ
kx = F_N cos θ + μF_N cos θ

premise: Horizontal Equilibrium: kx = F_N cos θ + μF_N cos θ

conclusion: F_N sin θ = μF_N sin θ

premise: Horizontal Equilibrium: kx = F_N cos θ (1 + μ)
